title: Decision-makers failing to find the target with way women's football matches are being marketed
text:
As a teenager, I spent many Saturday afternoons ladling sloppy noodles into paper pots and resentfully refilling ketchup and mustard stations on match days at Reading’s Madejski Stadium. This was when the Royals were living the high life in the Premier League and, unsurprisingly, the ground regularly reached capacity – a far cry from the drab occasion on Sunday when Reading Women were invited to play their Continental Cup fixture in the 24,000-seat stadium against Lewes.

It is hard to tell which is more worrying: that only 700 turned up, or that Reading will grace the Mad Stad turf on three further occasions next month. Manager Kelly Chambers even likened Sunday’s experience to playing an away...
description: As a teenager, I spent many Saturday afternoons ladling sloppy noodles into paper pots and resentfully refilling ketchup and mustard stations on match days at Reading’s Madejski Stadium.
